cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to accelerate north-northeast then northeast, crossing northwest Florida on 1 Sep and moving across south-central Georgia toward the Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Florida coast near Indian Pass–Cedar Key area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA (tropical-storm watch south of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line FL (tropical-storm warning); Anclote River to Indian Pass FL (hurricane watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of FL, then Atlantic coast from GA through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible late Thu night–Fri
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Georgia coast at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with isolated 10 inches; risk of flooding/flash-flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in southeast Georgia during Thu night–Fri
